title: With New President, Economic Optimisim Returns To Afghanistan
teaser: For most of 2014, Afghanistan was suffering from economic paralysis as its presidential election teetered on the brink of collapse. The inauguration of President Ashraf Ghani eased tensions and buoyed optimism that business will turn around.
contentencoded: Copyright 2015 NPR. To see more, visit http://www.npr.org/.
